eng: to begin at one point and then move to another, in distance or range
chisen: 跑步活動的出發地點是公園大門口。
engsen: The run starts at/from the entrance to the park .

eng: to move your body suddenly because something has surprised or frightened you
chisen: 電話鈴聲把他嚇了一跳。
engsen: He started at the sound of the phone .

eng: to (cause to) begin to work or operate
chisen: 我的車發動不起來。
engsen: I'm having trouble starting the car .

eng: a condition or way of being that exists at a particular time
chisen: 這棟大樓年久失修。
engsen: The building was in a state of disrepair .

eng: a country or its government
chisen: 中非國家旱情最重。
engsen: The drought is worst in the central African states .

eng: something that someone says or writes officially, or an action done to express an opinion
chisen: 預計政府會就該調查向媒體作出說明。
engsen: The government is expected to issue a statement about the investigation to the press .

eng: a building and the surrounding area where buses or trains stop for people to get on or off
chisen: 火車站
engsen: a railway station

eng: a company that broadcasts radio or television programmes
chisen: 廣播電台／電視台
engsen: a radio/television station

chi: （提供某種服務或進行某種工作的）站，所，局
eng: a building or place used for a particular service or type of work
chisen: 加油站
engsen: a petrol station

eng: a particular position that someone has been ordered to move into or to stay in
chisen: 警察沿著路邊各就各位，擋住人群。
engsen: The police took up their stations at the edge of the road , holding back the crowd .

eng: to not move away from or leave a place or situation
chisen: 他們需要一位願意留六個月的助手。
engsen: They need an assistant who is willing to stay for six months .

eng: to continue doing something, or to continue to be in a particular state
chisen: 不要到懸崖邊上去。
engsen: Stay away from the edge of the cliff .

eng: to live or be in a place for a short time as a visitor
chisen: 我在蒙特婁留了兩週，然後搭飛機回家。
engsen: I stayed in Montreal for two weeks then flew home .

eng: to move by lifting your foot and putting it down in a different place, or to put your foot on or in something
chisen: 她向後退，被一把椅子絆倒。
engsen: She stepped backwards and fell over a chair .

eng: continuing to happen or continuing to be done
chisen: 我還是很餓。
engsen: I'm still hungry .

eng: despite that
chisen: 你可能不贊成他的所作所為，但他仍然是你的兄弟。
engsen: You may not approve of what he did , but he's still your brother .

eng: to an even greater degree or in an even greater amount
chisen: 爆炸中喪生的人數有可能還會增加。
engsen: The number of people killed in the explosion is likely to rise still higher .

eng: the hard, solid substance found in the ground that is often used for building, or a piece of this
chisen: 石牆／石頭地面
engsen: a stone wall/floor

chi: 英石（重量單位，等於6.35公斤或14磅）
eng: a unit of weight equal to 14 pounds or 6.35 kilograms, used especially when talking about a person's weight
chisen: 我的體重是10.5英石。
engsen: I weigh ten and a half stone .

eng: a small piece of a hard, valuable substance, such as a diamond, that is found in the ground and used in jewellery
chisen: 寶石／半寶石
engsen: a precious/semiprecious stone

eng: a large, hard seed inside some types of fruit
chisen: 桃子、李子和橄欖都有果核。
engsen: Peaches , plums , and olives all contain stones .

eng: to finish doing something that you were doing
chisen: 我一開始吃巧克力，就停不了嘴。
engsen: Once I start eating chocolate , I can't stop .

eng: to prevent someone from doing something
chisen: 如果她真的想走，我不明白有甚麼事絆住了她。
engsen: If she really wants to leave , I don't understand what's stopping her .

eng: to stay in a place
chisen: 你是和我一起走，還是留在這裡？
engsen: Are you coming with me or are you stopping here ?

eng: to block a hole
chisen: 我們用些破布塞住了裂口。
engsen: We stopped (up) the gap with some rags .

eng: a large shop where you can buy many different types of goods
chisen: 百貨商場
engsen: a department store

eng: an amount of something that is being kept for future use
chisen: 他的酒窖裡儲存了數量驚人的葡萄酒。
engsen: He has an impressively large store of wine in his cellar .

chi: （真實或虛構的）故事；敘述，描述；小說
eng: a description, either true or imagined, of a connected series of events
chisen: 爸爸，能讀／講個故事給我聽嗎？
engsen: Will you read/tell me a story , daddy ?

eng: a level of a building
chisen: 他們的新房子包括閣樓一共有四層。
engsen: Their new house has four stories including the attic .

chi: 不尋常的；奇怪的；不可思議的
eng: unusual and unexpected, or difficult to understand
chisen: 他對女性有一些非常古怪的看法！
engsen: He has some very strange ideas about women !

eng: not known or familiar
chisen: 我不會搭陌生男人的車。
engsen: I don't accept rides from strange men .

eng: a road in a city or town that has buildings that are usually close together along one or both sides
chisen: 狂歡節過後，街上到處是垃圾。
engsen: The streets were strewn with rubbish after the parade .

chi: 強有力的，強勁的；強壯的；強烈的
eng: powerful; having or using great force or control
chisen: 能把這麼重的東西背在背上，她一定非常強健。
engsen: She must be very strong to carry such a weight on her back .

chi: 堅決的，堅定的，不動搖的
eng: difficult to argue with; firm and determined
chisen: 她有非常堅定的宗教主張。
engsen: She has strong opinions about religion .

chi: （味道、氣味等）濃的，重的，強烈的
eng: If a taste, smell, etc. is strong, it is very noticeable or powerful.
chisen: 一道強光直刺進我的眼裡。
engsen: A strong light was shining straight in my eyes .

chi: 牢固的，強健的；結實的；堅固的
eng: difficult to break, destroy, or make sick, or able to support a heavy weight or force
chisen: 結實的盒子／椅子
engsen: a strong box/chair

chi: 可能性很大的，很有可能的
eng: very likely to happen
chisen: 很有可能在隨後的幾個小時內找到孩子。
engsen: There's a strong possibility/likelihood of finding the child within the next few hours .

eng: having the stated number of people, members, etc.
chisen: 人群數量已經增加到幾百人。
engsen: The crowd had grown to be several hundred strong .

eng: a person who is learning at a college or university
chisen: 法律／哲學／醫學專業的學生
engsen: a law/philosophy/medical student

eng: to learn about a subject, especially in an educational course or by reading books
chisen: 攻讀生物學／化學
engsen: to study biology/chemistry

eng: to examine something very carefully
chisen: 簽字之前，我需要時間把這份合約徹底研究一下。
engsen: I want time to study this contract thoroughly before signing it .

chi: 愚蠢的；糊塗的；欠考慮的
eng: silly or unwise; showing poor judgment or little intelligence
chisen: 她就那樣辭掉了工作，簡直是愚蠢透頂。
engsen: She was really stupid to quit her job like that .

chi: （用於名詞或名詞片語前表示強調）如此，這麼
eng: used before a noun or noun phrase to add emphasis
chisen: 那部電影真不錯。
engsen: That's such a good film .

eng: a sweet substance especially from the plants sugar cane and sugar beet, used to make food and drinks sweet
chisen: 我的咖啡不加糖，謝謝。
engsen: I don't take sugar in my coffee , thanks .

eng: the star that provides light and heat for the earth and around which the earth moves
chisen: 太陽東升西落。
engsen: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west .

eng: the day of the week after Saturday and before Monday, when most people in Western countries do not go to work
chisen: 我們週日要去探望我的叔叔和嬸嬸。
engsen: We're going to visit my aunt and uncle on Sunday .

eng: excellent
chisen: 自然歷史博物館是孩子們的超級好去處。
engsen: The Natural History Museum is a super place for kids .

eng: a main meal eaten in the evening
chisen: 你今天一起來吃晚飯好嗎?
engsen: Why don't you come to/for supper tonight ?

eng: (especially of food or drink) having a taste similar to that of sugar; not bitter or salty
chisen: 這個鳳梨甜而多汁。
engsen: The pineapple was sweet and juicy .

chi: 愉快的，愜意的，令人滿意的
eng: If an emotion or event is sweet, it is very pleasant and satisfying.
chisen: 她沉浸在成功的喜悅中。
engsen: She was enjoying the sweet smell of success .

eng: to move through water by moving the body or parts of the body
chisen: 我們一整天都在海灘上，但天氣太冷，不能游泳。
engsen: We spent the day on the beach but it was too cold to go swimming .

eng: (of an object) to seem to move around
chisen: 因為起身太猛，她瞬間覺得整個房子好像都在旋轉。
engsen: Getting up too suddenly made the room swim before her eyes .

eng: a part of an animal's body, sticking out from the base of the back, or something similar in shape or position
chisen: 那隻狗興奮地搖著尾巴。
engsen: The dog wagged its tail excitedly .

eng: someone's bottom
chisen: 你別閑混了，開始找份工作吧。
engsen: You've just got to get off your tail and start looking for a job .

eng: to move something or someone from one place to another
chisen: 天氣預報說有雨，所以外出時記得帶傘。
engsen: The weather forecast said rain , so take your umbrella (with you) when you go out .

eng: to accept or have
chisen: 他們這裡接受信用卡嗎？
engsen: Do they take credit cards here ?

eng: to move in order to hold something in the hand(s)
chisen: 我開門的時候你幫我拿一下袋子，好嗎？
engsen: Can you take this bag while I open the door ?

eng: to go somewhere with someone, often paying for that person or being responsible for them
chisen: 星期六我們要帶孩子們去動物園。
engsen: We're taking the kids to the zoo on Saturday .

eng: to travel somewhere by using a particular form of transport or a particular vehicle, route, etc.
chisen: 我總是乘火車——乘火車比開車省事。
engsen: I always take the train - it's less hassle than a car .

eng: to need
chisen: 跳傘需要很大勇氣。
engsen: Parachuting takes a lot of nerve .

eng: to swallow or use a medicine or drug, especially in a regular way
chisen: 這種藥每天服用三次。
engsen: Take this medicine three times a day .

eng: to do or perform
chisen: 謝莉在大學唸經濟學。
engsen: Shelley is taking (= studying) economics at university .

chi: （以某一種特殊方式）思考，考慮
eng: to think about something or someone in a particular way
chisen: 我們非常重視炸彈恐嚇事件。
engsen: We're taking the bomb threats very seriously .

eng: to understand something in a particular way
chisen: 我不知道應該把這當作是恭維呢還是羞辱。
engsen: I'm not sure whether to take that as a compliment or an insult .

eng: to have or come to have a particular feeling or opinion
chisen: 他對孩子們漠不關心。
engsen: He doesn't take any interest in his children .

eng: to get possession of something or someone
chisen: 自由黨只需再獲得200票，就可以從工黨手中奪過該席位。
engsen: The Liberals need just 200 more votes to take the seat from Labour .

eng: to write
chisen: 我希望你們都在記筆記。
engsen: I hope you're all taking notes .

chi: （尤指包含離奇內容的）故事，不實之詞
eng: a story, especially one that might be invented or difficult to believe
chisen: 他講了他在印度生活的一些奇聞軼事。
engsen: He told some fascinating tales about his life in India .

eng: to say words aloud; to speak to someone
chisen: 我們剛才在談論葛瑞的新女友。
engsen: We were just talking about Gareth's new girlfriend .

chi: （為了尋求解決分歧的途徑而）與…會談
eng: to discuss something with someone, often to try to find a solution to a disagreement
chisen: 雙方同意會談。
engsen: The two sides have agreed to talk .

eng: to give a lecture on a subject
chisen: 下一位講者將就瀕危昆蟲作報告。
engsen: The next speaker will be talking about endangered insects .

eng: of more than average height, or of a particular height
chisen: 身材高挑的女孩
engsen: a tall girl

eng: the flavour of something, or the ability of a person or animal to recognize different flavours
chisen: 我喜歡蒜味。
engsen: I love the taste of garlic .

eng: a person's approval of and liking for particular things
chisen: 我一向不怎麼喜歡新車——倒是更喜歡老式汽車。
engsen: I'm not really into new cars - old vintage cars are more to my taste (= what I like) .

eng: a short experience of something
chisen: 夏天我體驗了一下在辦公室工作的滋味，可真夠我受的。
engsen: I had a taste of office work during the summer and that was enough .

eng: a car with a driver who you pay to take you somewhere
chisen: 我從車站乘計程車去飯店。
engsen: I took a taxi from the station to the hotel .

eng: (a drink made by pouring hot water onto) dried and cut leaves and sometimes flowers, especially the leaves of the tea plant
chisen: 多種花草茶
engsen: a selection of herbal teas

eng: to say something to someone, often giving them information or instructions
chisen: 那麼跟我說說你的假期吧。
engsen: Tell me about your holiday then .

eng: to know, recognize, or be certain
chisen: 我看得出你當時很不高興。
engsen: I could tell (that) you were unhappy .

eng: to have an effect
chisen: 她最近壓力很大，而且這已經開始令她吃不消了。
engsen: She's been under a lot of stress recently and it's starting to tell .

eng: the number 10
chisen: 她的父親在十年前去世了。
engsen: Her father died ten years ago .

eng: used to join two parts of a comparison
chisen: 我的兒子比女兒高得多。
engsen: My son is a lot taller than my daughter .

eng: to express to someone that you are pleased about or are grateful for something that they have done
chisen: 他感謝我送他回家。
engsen: He thanked me for taking him home .

chi: （用於名詞前，指聽者或讀者已知的事物或人，尤指已提到的或能被領會的事物或人）
eng: used before nouns to refer to particular things or people that have already been talked about or are already known or that are in a situation where it is clear what is happening
chisen: 我剛買了一件新襯衣和幾雙新鞋。襯衣很貴，但鞋子不貴。
engsen: I just bought a new shirt and some new shoes . The shirt was pretty expensive , but the shoes weren't .

eng: used instead of a possessive adjective such as your, her, or my
chisen: 他抓著女兒的胳膊。
engsen: He held his daughter by the arm (= her arm) .

eng: enough
chisen: 我倒是想今晚出去玩，但又覺得自己沒那個精力。
engsen: I'd like to go out tonight , but I don't think I have the energy .

eng: each; every
chisen: 這輛車每加侖汽油能跑30英里。
engsen: It does 30 miles to the gallon .

eng: of or belonging to them
chisen: 他把他們的外衣交給了他們。
engsen: He gave them their coats .

chi: 他們的，她們的，它們的（所有物）
eng: the one(s) belonging to or connected with them
chisen: 那些孩子是他們的？
engsen: Which children are theirs ?

eng: used, usually as the object of a verb or preposition, to refer to people, things, animals, situations, or ideas that have already been mentioned
chisen: 我丟了鎖匙，到處都找不著。
engsen: I've lost my keys . I can't find them anywhere .

chi: 在當時（過去或未來）（的）；在那時（的）
eng: (at) that time (in the past or in the future)
chisen: 那時我在城裡工作。
engsen: I was working in the city then .

eng: (to, at, or in) that place
chisen: 把椅子放在那裡。
engsen: Put the chair there .

chi: （用於引出句子，尤用於動詞 be，seem 和 appear 前）
eng: used to introduce the subject of a sentence, especially before the verbs be, seem, and appear
chisen: 我拿出錢包，發現一分錢都沒有。
engsen: I took out my wallet but there was no money in it .

eng: used as the subject of a verb to refer to people, animals, or things already mentioned or, more generally, to a group of people not clearly described
chisen: 我的眼鏡哪裡去了？剛才還在桌子上。
engsen: Where are my glasses ? They were on the table a minute ago .

eng: used to refer in an approximate way to an object or to avoid naming it
chisen: 那邊的是甚麼東西？
engsen: What's that thing over there ?

eng: used to refer in an approximate way to an idea, subject, event, action, etc.
chisen: 那樣說是不友好的。
engsen: That was an unkind thing to say .

eng: used to refer to the general situation
chisen: 最近情況很好。
engsen: Things have been going very well recently .

eng: used instead of "anything" or "everything" to emphasize what you are saying
chisen: 甚麼事情也不要操心，我會料理好一切。
engsen: Don't worry about a thing (= anything) . I'll take care of it .

eng: used to talk about a particular action, agreement, etc.
chisen: 我是乘飛機去的——我很少這樣。
engsen: I went by plane , a thing I hardly ever do .

eng: used to introduce a reason for something
chisen: 「你為甚麼不跟我到紐約來？」「首先，我不喜歡坐飛機；再者，我買不起機票。」
engsen: "Why won't you come to New York with me?" "For one thing , I don't like flying , and for another , I can't afford it."

chi: 人，傢夥，東西（指人或動物，帶有疼愛或憐憫的感情色彩）
eng: used after an adjective to refer to a person or animal with love or sympathy
chisen: 這些可憐的東西都被關在小籠子裡，連動一動的空間都沒有。
engsen: The poor things were kept in small cages without room to move .

eng: to believe something or have an opinion or idea
chisen: 我覺得以前見過你。
engsen: I think (that) I've met you before .

chi: 思考，考慮（動腦筋決定做某事）
eng: to use the brain to decide to do something
chisen: 我在考慮開始跑步。
engsen: I'm thinking of taking up running .

eng: to use the brain to plan something, solve a problem, understand a situation, etc.
chisen: 彼得，你在想甚麼呢？
engsen: What are you thinking , Peter ?

eng: to remember or imagine
chisen: 你來電時我正在想你。
engsen: I was just thinking about you when you called .

eng: 3rd written as a word
chisen: 右邊第三條路
engsen: the third road on the right

eng: the number 13
chisen: 一些人認為十三是個不吉利的數字。
engsen: Some people think that thirteen is an unlucky number .

eng: the number 30
engsen: twenty-nine , thirty , thirty-one

eng: used for a person, object, idea, etc. to show which one is referred to
chisen: 請你在這表上簽個名好嗎？
engsen: Can you sign this form here for me ?

eng: despite the fact that
chisen: 雖然她說過要打電話，可還沒打。
engsen: She hasn't called , even though she said she would .

eng: the number 1,000
chisen: 他們駕車超過一千英里。
engsen: They had driven over a/one thousand miles .

eng: the number 3
chisen: 我有三個姐妹。
engsen: I've got three sisters .

eng: the day of the week after Wednesday and before Friday
chisen: 星期四下班後我去理髮。
engsen: I'm getting my hair cut after work on Thursday .

eng: in this way
chisen: 彎腰，就這樣。
engsen: Bend from the waist , thus .

eng: a small piece of paper or card given to someone, usually to show that they have paid for an event, journey, or activity
chisen: 音樂會票
engsen: a concert ticket

chi: （貨物上標明價目、尺碼等的）標籤，簽條
eng: a piece of card or paper that is put on an object to show its size or price
chisen: 價格標籤
engsen: a price ticket

chi: （選舉中某政黨的）候選人名單
eng: a number of people representing a particular political party in an election
chisen: 共和黨／民主黨候選人名單
engsen: the Republican/Democratic ticket

eng: to fasten together two ends of a piece of string or other long, thin material, or to (cause to) hold together with a long, thin piece of string, material, etc.
chisen: 你能幫我把這個繩子打個結嗎？
engsen: Could you tie this piece of string for me ?

eng: to relate to or connect to
chisen: 比如說，過敏症與奶製品有關係嗎？
engsen: Is the allergy tied to dairy products , for example ?

eng: to finish at the same time or score the same number of points, etc. in a competition as someone or something else
chisen: 在拼寫比賽中（爭奪第一名時）我和簡打成平手。
engsen: Jane and I tied (for first place) in the spelling test .

chi: 強悍的人；勁頭十足的人；虎將
eng: used to refer to someone who is very determined and strong
chisen: 在現今最溫順聽話的妻子，以她祖母的標準來看，都稱得上是母老虎。
engsen: The meekest , most submissive wife of today is a tiger by her grandmother's standards .

eng: the part of existence that is measured in minutes, days, years, etc., or this process considered as a whole
chisen: 他想多花時間陪家人。
engsen: He wants to spend more time with his family .

eng: the system of recording hours used in different parts of the world
chisen: 格林威治標準時間
engsen: Greenwich Mean Time

eng: an amount of time that you have available to do something
chisen: 我不知道你是怎麼抽出時間做所有這些事情的。
engsen: I don't know how you find time to do all the things you do .

eng: a particular period of time for which something has been happening, or that is needed for something
chisen: 過了一陣子，情況變得很明顯，沒有人想來參加會議。
engsen: After a time , it became clear that nobody was interested in coming to the meetings .

eng: a particular point in the day, as expressed in hours and minutes or shown on a clock, or a particular point in time
chisen: 現在幾點了？
engsen: What time is it ?

chi: （從事特定活動或某事應該發生的）時間，時候
eng: a particular point of the day, year, etc. that is suitable for a particular activity, or at which something is expected to happen
chisen: 現在收拾好玩具，該睡覺了。
engsen: Put your toys away now - it's time for bed .

eng: an occasion when something happens, or the experience connected with it
chisen: 上次我們去巴黎的時候，每天都下雨。
engsen: The last time we went to Paris , it rained every day .

eng: a period in history
chisen: 小說《雙城記》是以法國大革命時期為背景的。
engsen: "A Tale of Two Cities" is set at the time of the French Revolution .

eng: Your time in a race is the number of minutes, hours, etc. you take to complete it.
chisen: 她的馬拉松成績略低於三小時。
engsen: Her time for the marathon was just under three hours .

eng: the number of beats in a bar of music, or the speed at which a piece of music is intended to be played
chisen: 這支曲子是四四拍的。
engsen: This piece is written in 4/4 time .

eng: to spend a period of time in prison
chisen: 出獄後要找到工作可不容易。
engsen: It's not always easy to find a job after you've done time .

eng: the particular point in the day at which people who are drinking in a bar in the UK have to finish their drinks and leave
chisen: 已經到打烊的時間了嗎？
engsen: Is it time already ?

eng: extremely small
chisen: 極小的花
engsen: a tiny flower

eng: to begin to feel as if you have no energy and want to rest or go to sleep, or to make someone feel this way
chisen: 她在整個賽跑中一路領先，但現在看上去似乎累了。
engsen: She's been leading throughout the race , but it now looks as if she's tiring .

eng: in the direction of
chisen: 我們坐公車去城裡，好嗎？
engsen: We're going to town on the bus , okay ?

eng: used for showing who receives something or who experiences an action
chisen: 我把腳踏車借給了我哥哥。
engsen: I lent my bike to my brother .

eng: until a particular time, state, or level is reached
chisen: 離聖誕節只有兩星期。
engsen: It's only two weeks to Christmas .

eng: used to suggest an extreme state
chisen: 看看你的襯衫——都成碎片了！
engsen: Look at your shirt - it's torn to shreds !

eng: in connection with
chisen: 他們對你的詢問作何反應？
engsen: What was their response to your query ?

chi: （用於不定式前，通常和 be 連用，構成未來式）
eng: used before an infinitive, usually with 'be', to indicate a future action
chisen: 今天政府宣佈明年要削減對藝術的資助。
engsen: The government announced today that it is to cut funding for the arts for next year .

eng: causing a particular feeling in a particular person
chisen: 令我驚訝的是，那時候我得知她正要到這裡來。
engsen: That's when I found out , to my amazement , that she was coming here .

eng: considered by
chisen: 我意識到，對你而言這聽上去可能很奇怪。
engsen: I realize it may sound strange to you .

eng: serving
chisen: 他做富人和名流的私人教練一年賺100多萬美元。
engsen: As a personal trainer to the rich and famous , he earns over a million dollars a year .

eng: against or very near
chisen: 背靠背站著。
engsen: Stand back to back .

eng: matching or belonging to
chisen: 爸爸把他的車匙給了我。
engsen: My dad gave me the keys to his car .

eng: used to show the position of something or someone in comparison with something or someone else
chisen: 照片中約翰站在阿德里安的左邊。
engsen: John's standing to the left of Adrian in the photo .

chi: 為向…表示敬意；為了紀念
eng: in honour or memory of
chisen: 我提議為新娘新郎乾杯。
engsen: I proposed a toast to the bride and the groom .

eng: for each
chisen: 一英鎊等於多少美元？
engsen: How many dollars are there to the pound ?

eng: used in phrases that show a range
chisen: 那裡可能有30到35個人。
engsen: There were probably 30 to 35 (= a number between 30 and 35) people there .

chi: 與（音樂或其他聲音）同時，伴隨
eng: at the same time as music or other sound
chisen: 我喜歡跟著音樂做運動。
engsen: I like exercising to music .

eng: relating to a positive reaction or result
chisen: 把義大利麵煮到你認為合適的程度時，倒掉水。
engsen: When the pasta is done to your liking , drain the water .

eng: compared with
chisen: 她的收入還可以，但如果她在私人企業工作收入會高得多。
engsen: She's earning a reasonable wage , but nothing to what she could if she was in the private sector .

eng: (on) the present day
chisen: 今天幾號？
engsen: What's the date today ?

eng: with each other
chisen: 我們過去常常一起去做瑜伽。
engsen: We used to go to yoga together .

eng: at the same time
chisen: 這些包裹是分別寄出的，但是都一起到了。
engsen: The packages were sent separately , but they all came together .

eng: combined
chisen: 合起來他們一年肯定能賺30多萬美元。
engsen: Together they must earn over $300,000 a year .

eng: in one place
chisen: 我只要把我的東西收拾在一起，然後我們就可以離開。
engsen: I'll just gather my stuff together , and then we can go .

eng: in addition to; and also
chisen: 我欠你的電話費加上房租一共是300英鎊。
engsen: The money that I owe you for the phone together with the rent equals £300 .

eng: (on) the day after today
chisen: 我明天晚上跟瑞秋共進晚餐。
engsen: I'm having dinner with Rachel tomorrow night .

chi: （常指對聽話人的）語氣，腔調，口吻
eng: a quality in the voice that expresses the speaker's feelings or thoughts, often towards the person being spoken to
chisen: 我試著用一種同情的語氣說話。
engsen: I tried to use a sympathetic tone of voice .

eng: the general mood or main qualities of something
chisen: 我不喜歡這篇文章的搞笑風格——我覺得這不恰當。
engsen: I didn't like the jokey tone of the article - I thought it was inappropriate .

eng: a form or degree of a colour
chisen: 棕色和黃色這種暖色調
engsen: warm tones of brown and yellow

eng: the healthy tightness of the body, especially the muscles
chisen: 你生完孩子後，腹部的肌肉就失去了彈性。
engsen: After you've had a baby you lose the muscle tone in your stomach .

chi: 全音（指西洋音階中相鄰兩音符之間最大的音差）
eng: the largest difference in pitch between two notes that are next to each other in the western musical scale
chisen: 從 G 到 A 的音程是一個全音。
engsen: The interval from G to A is a whole tone .

eng: the quality of sound of a musical instrument or singing voice
chisen: 他那美妙渾厚的男高音
engsen: the beautiful rich tones of his tenor voice

eng: one of the continuous sounds that you hear on a phone that tell you if the other phone is ringing, if it is busy, etc.
chisen: 我已經給他打了幾次電話，但每次聽到的都是忙線中。
engsen: I've called him several times but I keep getting the engaged tone .

eng: (during) the night of the present day
chisen: 今晚將是我與她見面的第一次機會。
engsen: Tonight will be my first chance to meet her .

eng: more than is needed or wanted; more than is suitable or enough
chisen: 我太胖了。
engsen: I'm too fat .

eng: (especially at the end of a sentence) in addition, also
chisen: 我也想來。
engsen: I'd like to come too .

eng: very, or completely
chisen: 我告訴他這個錯誤時，他不太高興。
engsen: He wasn't too pleased/happy when I told him about the mistake .

eng: someone whose decisions and actions are unfairly controlled by others
chisen: 該總統被人們廣泛視為軍方的工具。
engsen: The president was widely regarded as the tool of the military .

eng: the highest place or part
chisen: 她在樓梯梯頂位置等我。
engsen: She waited for me at the top of the stairs .

eng: any piece of light clothing worn on the part of the body above the waist
chisen: 暴露的上裝
engsen: a skimpy top

eng: the cover or lid used to close a container or pen
chisen: 螺旋蓋
engsen: a screw-on top

chi: 最重要的職位；最高的地位
eng: the most important position in a group or organization
chisen: 40歲時，他處於職場生涯的頂峰。
engsen: At 40 , he was at the top of his profession .

eng: the leaves of a vegetable plant grown mainly for its roots
chisen: 我們拿一些甜菜葉子餵這隻兔子。
engsen: We fed the rabbit some beetroot tops .

eng: the amount you get when several smaller amounts are added together
chisen: 一天中的那個時候，只有一人乘坐的汽車幾乎佔車輛總數的80%。
engsen: At that time of day , cars with only one occupant accounted for almost 80 percent of the total .

eng: to put your hand or another part of your body lightly onto and off something or someone
chisen: 那塊油漆未乾——別碰（它）。
engsen: That paint is wet - don't touch (it) .

chi: （兩個或兩個以上的物品）接觸
eng: (of two or more things) to be so close together that there is no space between; to be in contact
chisen: 他一頭倒在枕頭上便睡著了。
engsen: He fell asleep as soon as his head touched the pillow .

chi: 傷害（某人）；使用（某物）；破壞（某物）
eng: to harm someone, or use or damage something
chisen: 我不在時候請不要碰我的東西。
engsen: Please don't touch any of my stuff while I'm away .

eng: (usually used in negative sentences) to eat or drink something
chisen: 我們留下來給他們的食物，他們一點也沒碰。
engsen: They didn't touch any of the food we left for them .

eng: to influence someone or something emotionally, or cause feelings of sympathy in someone
chisen: 他們兒子16歲那年，他們的生活發生了悲劇。
engsen: Tragedy touched their lives when their son was 16 .

eng: (usually used in negative sentences) to have or reach the same standard (= level of quality) as someone or something
chisen: 她的小說不及她姐姐的好。
engsen: Her novels can't touch (= are not as good as) those of her sister .

eng: in the direction of, or closer to someone or something
chisen: 她站起身來，向他走去。
engsen: She stood up and walked towards him .

eng: in relation to something or someone
chisen: 他們對我總是很友好。
engsen: They've always been very friendly towards me .

eng: near to, just before, or around a time or place
chisen: 我們的座位靠近劇院的後排。
engsen: Our seats were towards the back of the theatre .

eng: for the purpose of buying or achieving something
chisen: 我正在存錢買車，爸爸也資助了我點錢。
engsen: I'm saving up to buy a car , and Dad has given me some money towards it .

eng: in the direction of, or closer to someone or something
chisen: 她站起身來，向他走去。
engsen: She stood up and walked towards him .

eng: in relation to something or someone
chisen: 他們對我總是很友好。
engsen: They've always been very friendly towards me .

eng: near to, just before, or around a time or place
chisen: 我們的座位靠近劇院的後排。
engsen: Our seats were towards the back of the theatre .

eng: for the purpose of buying or achieving something
chisen: 我正在存錢買車，爸爸也資助了我點錢。
engsen: I'm saving up to buy a car , and Dad has given me some money towards it .

eng: a place where people live and work, containing many houses, shops, places of work, places of entertainment, etc., and usually larger than a village but smaller than a city
chisen: 海濱城鎮
engsen: a seaside/coastal town

eng: an object for children to play with
chisen: 裝有發條的玩具
engsen: a clockwork/wind-up toy

eng: a railway engine connected to carriages for carrying people or to wheeled containers for carrying goods
chisen: 一列貨運／客運列車
engsen: a goods/freight/passenger train

eng: a series of connected thoughts or events
chisen: 是怎樣的思路使你從拿破崙想到全球變暖？
engsen: What amazing train of thought led you from Napoleon to global warming ?

eng: the part of a long dress that spreads out onto the floor behind the person wearing it
chisen: 拖著長長的裙裾且手工精細的婚紗
engsen: an elaborate wedding dress with a long train

eng: a tall plant that has a wooden trunk and branches that grow from its upper part
chisen: 李子／蘋果／栗子樹
engsen: a plum/apple/chestnut tree

eng: a journey in which you go somewhere, usually for a short time, and come back again
chisen: 乘火車從約克到新堡大約要一個小時。
engsen: The trip from York to Newcastle takes about an hour by train .

eng: an occasion when you knock your foot against something and fall or lose your balance, or someone causes you to do this, when you are walking or running
chisen: 她在樓梯上重重地絆了一跤，把腳踝摔斷了。
engsen: She broke her ankle when she had a nasty trip on the stairs .

eng: an experience in which someone sees, hears, or feels things that do not exist as a result of taking an illegal drug
chisen: 如果你心情沮喪時服用這種東西，會產生一種特別不舒服的幻覺。
engsen: If you take this stuff when you're depressed , you'll have a really bad trip .

eng: problems or difficulties
chisen: 這張稅務表格十分複雜，我填起來很費勁。
engsen: The tax forms were complicated and I had a lot of trouble with them .

eng: slight problems or effort
chisen: 我並不想給你添任何麻煩。
engsen: I didn't mean to cause you any trouble .

chi: （尤指事實或陳述）正確的，真實的，確實的；如實的
eng: (especially of facts or statements) right and not wrong; correct
chisen: 瑪麗安娜和馬克真的要結婚嗎？
engsen: Is it true that Mariana and Mark are getting married ?

eng: being what exists, rather than what was thought, intended, or stated
chisen: 真正的朋友
engsen: a true friend

eng: sincere or loyal, and likely to continue to be so in difficult situations
chisen: 黨內虔誠信仰共產主義的黨員所剩無幾。
engsen: There are few true believers in communism left in the party .

chi: 真正的，純正的；名副其實的；典型的
eng: having all the characteristics necessary to be accurately described as something
chisen: 只有純種鹿才有鹿角。
engsen: Only true deer have antlers .

chi: 位於正確位置的；端正的
eng: fitted or positioned accurately
chisen: 沒有一個抽屜裝正了位置。
engsen: None of the drawers were true .

eng: to attempt to do something
chisen: 不斷努力，你最終會找到工作的。
engsen: Keep trying and you'll find a job eventually .

eng: to test something to see if it is suitable or useful or if it works
chisen: 我昨晚嘗試了你給我的那個食譜。
engsen: I tried that recipe you gave me last night .

eng: to examine a person accused of committing a crime in a law court by asking them questions and considering known facts, and then decide if they are guilty
chisen: 出於安全上的考慮，那些軍官受到秘密審判。
engsen: Because of security implications the officers were tried in secret .

eng: to worry or annoy someone or upset a person's patience with many, often slight, difficulties
chisen: 這項工作的苛刻要求使他深受折磨。
engsen: The demands of the job have tried him sorely .

chi: T恤衫，短袖圓領汗衫，短袖圓領運動衫
eng: a simple piece of clothing, usually with short sleeves and no collar, that covers the top part of the body
chisen: 她穿著牛仔褲和T恤。
engsen: She was wearing jeans and a T-shirt .

eng: the day of the week after Monday and before Wednesday
chisen: 我們週二八點見。
engsen: We'll meet at eight on Tuesday .

eng: the stomach, or the lower front part of the body
chisen: 肚子痛
engsen: a tummy ache

eng: to (cause to) move in a circle around a fixed point or line
chisen: 地球每24小時繞地軸自轉一周。
engsen: The earth turns on its axis once every 24 hours .

eng: to (cause to) change the direction in which you are facing or moving
chisen: 在紅綠燈處向右拐。
engsen: Turn right at the traffic lights .

chi: 翻動（書頁）；（使）翻轉；（使）翻身
eng: to move, or to move an object or page, so that a different side or surface is on the top
chisen: 現在請翻到下一頁，開始做練習二。
engsen: Now turn the page , please , and start work on Exercise 2 .

eng: to (cause to) become, change into, or come to be something
chisen: 天氣突然變涼。
engsen: The weather has suddenly turned cold .

chi: 旋動，擰動（操縱裝置）；（為升高或降低…而）旋動，擰動
eng: to use a control to switch a piece of equipment or a power or water supply on or off, or to increase or reduce what it is producing
chisen: 關燈。
engsen: Turn off/out the light .

eng: to damage the muscles in the foot by suddenly twisting it too strongly
chisen: 她在石頭上崴了腳，不得不蹣跚著走回營地。
engsen: She turned her ankle on the rocks and had to hobble back to camp .

eng: to shape a piece of wood while it is attached to a machine that spins it
chisen: 車成的碗
engsen: a turned bowl

eng: the number 12
chisen: 餐廳十二點開門供應午餐。
engsen: The cafeteria opens for lunch at twelve (o'clock) .

eng: the number 20
engsen: nineteen , twenty , twenty-one

eng: two times
chisen: 我已經問過他兩次了。
engsen: I've already asked him twice .

eng: the number 2
chisen: 他們有兩幢房子。
engsen: They have two houses .

chi: 舅父；伯父；叔父；姨父；姑父
eng: the brother of someone's mother or father, or the husband of someone's aunt or uncle
chisen: 我有很多叔叔、舅舅、姑姑和姨媽。
engsen: I have lots of uncles and aunts .

chi: 在（或到）下面；在（或到）下方
eng: in or to a position below or lower than something else, often so that one thing covers the other
chisen: 他躲在床底下。
engsen: He hid under the bed .

eng: less than
chisen: 所有物品價格均低於一英鎊。
engsen: All items cost/are under a pound .

eng: happening during, as a result of, or according to a particular situation, event, rule, etc.
chisen: 這項工作是在極端困難的情況下完成的。
engsen: The work was completed under very difficult conditions .

eng: controlled or governed by a particular person, organization, or force
chisen: 他是一名上校，手下有數百名士兵。
engsen: He's a Colonel , with hundreds of soldiers under him (= obeying his orders) .

eng: using a particular name, especially one that is not your real name
chisen: 他用約翰•勒•卡雷這個名字創作。
engsen: He writes under the name (of) John le Carré .

eng: to know the meaning of something that someone says
chisen: 她把整個想法又解釋了一遍，但我還是不明白。
engsen: She explained the whole idea again , but I still didn't understand .

eng: to know or realize something because you have been told it
chisen: 我聽說你想從我們這裡借些錢。
engsen: I understand (that) you are interested in borrowing some money from us .

eng: a single thing or a separate part of something larger
chisen: 課本的每個單元各有不同的文法重點。
engsen: Each unit of the text book focuses on a different grammar point .

chi: （尤指具有特定目的的）班組，小隊
eng: a group of people living or working together, especially for a particular purpose
chisen: 傳統的家庭單位
engsen: the traditional family unit

eng: a standard measure that is used to express amounts
chisen: 厘米是長度單位。
engsen: A centimetre is a unit of length .

eng: a department in a hospital for the treatment of people with similar illnesses or conditions
chisen: 她在燒傷科／兒科／精神科。
engsen: She's in the burns/paediatric/psychiatric unit .

eng: any whole number less than ten
chisen: 十位數在左欄，個位數在右欄。
engsen: Tens go in the left-hand column and units in the right .

eng: up to (the time that)
chisen: 為了完成工作，我一直熬夜做到三點！
engsen: I was up until three o'clock trying to get it finished !

eng: as far as
chisen: 你應該坐火車一直坐到曼徹斯特，然後再換車。
engsen: You should stay on the train until Manchester and then change .

eng: up to (the time that); until
chisen: 我們一直等你到六點半。
engsen: We waited till six thirty for you .

chi: 向較高處；向上；（價值、數位或水準）加大地；增高地
eng: towards a higher position; towards a higher value, number, or level
chisen: 把那些書放到書架頂層上去。
engsen: Put those books up on the top shelf .

chi: 處於直立狀態地；垂直地
eng: in or into a vertical position
chisen: 你能站起來一會兒嗎，我想看看你有多高。
engsen: Would you stand up for a minute ? I want to see how tall you are .

eng: in a high position; at the top
chisen: 我們的會議室在上面的23層。
engsen: Our boardroom is up on the 23rd floor .

eng: very near
chisen: 他拿著槍，走到收銀員跟前逼其把錢拿出來。
engsen: Carrying a gun , he walked up to the cashier and demanded money .

chi: 由弱到強地；由低到高地
eng: to a greater degree; in order to increase
chisen: 爐火使房間在幾分鐘內就暖和起來。
engsen: The fire heats the room up (= makes it warmer) within minutes .

eng: not in bed
chisen: 現在該起床啦！
engsen: It's time to get up now !

chi: （表示出現、發生、看到、給予考慮等）
eng: into existence, view, or attention
chisen: 成立這間慈善機構的初衷是要幫助城裡的孤兒。
engsen: Originally the charity was set up to help orphans in urban areas .

chi: （在品質、知識或成就方面）相等，比得上
eng: so as to be equal in quality, knowledge, or achievement
chisen: 她因病幾週不能去上課，但她（的功課）很快就能趕上來。
engsen: She couldn't go to school for a few weeks because of illness , but she'll be able to catch up (with her work) quickly .

eng: in a state of being together with other similar things
chisen: 你有半個小時的時間來收拾旅途中所需的東西。
engsen: You have half an hour to gather up anything you'll need for the journey .

eng: tightly or firmly in order to keep something safe or in position
chisen: 把袋口綁好，這樣垃圾不會掉出來。
engsen: Tie up the top of the bag so the rubbish doesn't fall out .

eng: broken or cut into smaller pieces; made smaller in area
chisen: 他把信剪得粉粹。
engsen: He cut the letter up into a hundred pieces .

eng: to a greater age
chisen: 沒有人認爲成長很輕鬆、沒有痛苦。
engsen: No one said that growing up would be easy or painless .

chi: （用於談論或詢問發生了甚麽事）
eng: used when talking or asking about what is happening
chisen: 大家都在竊竊私語，我可以斷定一定發生了甚麽不同尋常的事。
engsen: Everyone was talking in whispers , and I could tell something was up (= something unusual was happening) .

eng: When a period of time is up, it is finished.
chisen: 兩個小時過去了，沒有人回答完所有問題。
engsen: When the two hours were up nobody had answered all of the questions .

eng: into an improved position or state
chisen: 到第26圈，漢密爾頓已上升至二位。
engsen: By lap 26 , Hamilton had moved up into second position .

eng: to an end, finish, or state of being complete
chisen: 先把舊的那個麵包吃完，再開始吃新的。
engsen: Finish up the old loaf of bread before you start a new one .

eng: towards the north
chisen: 週二她將從新奧爾良北上前往亞特蘭大。
engsen: On Tuesday she'll be travelling up to Atlanta from New Orleans .

chi: 計劃要；被建議；正被考慮
eng: intended, suggested, or being considered for something
chisen: 我們這條路盡頭的那座房子又要出售了。
engsen: That house at the end of our road is up for sale again .

eng: willing and able to do or take part in an activity
chisen: 工作了一整天之後，我真的不願意參加甚麼聚會了。
engsen: After a long day at work I wasn't really up for a party .

eng: on trial in a court
chisen: 如果他不馬上交上罰款，就將會被地方法庭傳訊。
engsen: If he doesn't pay the fine soon , he'll be up before the magistrate .

eng: When a road is up, it is being repaired and so is unsuitable for use.
chisen: 因爲下水管道破裂，市政會正在整修道路。
engsen: The council has got the road up because of a broken sewer .

eng: If someone's long hair is up, it is arranged on the top or back of the head.
chisen: 你頭髮向上梳看起來很好看。
engsen: You look nice with your hair up .

eng: towards or on the highest floor or floors of a building
chisen: 樓上的平臺／窗戶
engsen: an upstairs landing/window

chi: （用作動詞或介詞的受詞）我們
eng: used as the object of a verb or a preposition to refer to a group that includes the speaker and at least one other person
chisen: 謝謝您載我們去車站。
engsen: Thank you for driving us to the station .

eng: (especially used in spoken English) me
chisen: 借個火，老兄。
engsen: Give us a light , mate .

eng: to put something such as a tool, skill, or building to a particular purpose
chisen: 這個杯子用過了——請給我拿一個乾淨的。
engsen: This glass has been used - could you get me a clean one ?

eng: to reduce the amount of or finish something, by eating it, burning it, writing on it, or by a chemical reaction
chisen: 我們的麵包差不多都吃光了——你能再買一些嗎?
engsen: We've used (up) nearly all of the bread - will you buy some more ?

chi: 說或寫（特定的單詞或片語）
eng: to say or write a particular word or phrase
chisen: 「秋天」在英國英語中是autumn，在美國英語中是fall。
engsen: "Autumn" is used in British English and "fall" in American English .

eng: to take advantage of a person or situation; to exploit
chisen: 他只是在利用你——他會竊取你的想法，然後把功勞都算到自己頭上。
engsen: He's just using you - he'll steal your ideas and then take the credit for them himself .

chi: （在否定句和疑問句中，在 did 或 didn't 後 used to 變爲 use to）
eng: In negative sentences and questions, "use to" replaces "used to" when it follows "did" or "didn't"
chisen: 他曾經在《星際迷航》中扮演過醫生嗎?
engsen: Did he use to be the doctor in "Star Trek" ?

chi: 有用的，有效的；有助益的
eng: effective; helping you to do or achieve something
chisen: 一把好刀應該是廚房裡最有用的物件之一。
engsen: A good knife is probably one of the most useful things you can have in a kitchen .

eng: a plant, root, seed, or pod that is used as food, especially in dishes that are not sweet
chisen: 水果和蔬菜
engsen: fruit and vegetables

chi: 懶散的人；對任何事都毫無興趣的人
eng: a person who does not do anything or has no interest in doing anything
chisen: 整天坐在家裡看電視，她慢慢地變成了一個懶散的人。
engsen: Sitting at home all day in front of the TV slowly turned her into a vegetable .

chi: （用於強調形容詞或副詞）很，非常
eng: (used to add emphasis to an adjective or adverb) to a great degree or extremely
chisen: 形勢非常嚴峻。
engsen: The situation is very serious .

eng: an opinion, belief, or idea, or a way of thinking about something
chisen: 對於我們現在該做甚麼你有甚麼看法？
engsen: Do you have any views about/on what we should do now ?

eng: what you can see from a particular place, or the ability to see from a particular place
chisen: 從山頂上望去，景色令人歎為觀止／美不勝收／壯觀極了。
engsen: The view from the top of the mountain is breathtaking/magnificent/spectacular .

eng: to go to a place in order to look at it, or to a person in order to spend time with them
chisen: 我們在布拉格時參觀了幾家畫廊。
engsen: We visited a few galleries while we were in Prague .

eng: the sounds that are made when people speak or sing
chisen: 她說話聲音很大／很輕／很柔。
engsen: She has a loud/quiet/soft voice .

chi: 意見的表達；發言權；表達意見的權利
eng: (the right to) an expression of opinion
chisen: 討論中只有一個不同的聲音。
engsen: There was only one dissenting voice during the discussion .

eng: the relationship between the subject of the verb and the action described by the verb, or the forms of a verb that show this relationship
chisen: 主動／被動語態
engsen: the active/passive voice

eng: to allow time to go by, especially while staying in one place without doing very much, until someone comes, until something that you are expecting happens or until you can do something
chisen: 她進去看病時，我在外面等她。
engsen: I waited for her outside while she went in to see the doctor .

eng: to move along by putting one foot in front of the other, allowing each foot to touch the ground before lifting the next
chisen: 我走路回家的。
engsen: I walked home .

eng: to be allowed to leave a court after being found not guilty of a crime
chisen: 如果警方找不到合適的證據，他就可以解脫嫌疑。
engsen: If police don't get the right evidence , he'll walk .

chi: 輕鬆通過（考試）；輕鬆取得（比賽）的勝利
eng: to pass or win something, such as an exam or game, easily
chisen: 她會輕鬆通過面試的——那份工作實際上已經是她的了。
engsen: She'll walk the interview - the job is practically hers already .

eng: a vertical structure, often made of stone or brick, that divides or surrounds something
chisen: 這間公寓的牆太薄了，甚至隔壁的人說的每一句話你都可以聽見。
engsen: The walls in this apartment are so thin you can hear just about every word the neighbours say .

chi: 想要，希望（英國英語中禮貌的請求不用 want）
eng: to wish for a particular thing or plan of action. "Want" is not used in polite requests
chisen: 我想要些巧克力。
engsen: I want some chocolate .

eng: to need something
chisen: 你覺得這湯裡要不要加點鹽？
engsen: Do you think this soup wants a bit of salt ?

eng: armed fighting between two or more countries or groups, or a particular example of this
chisen: 戰爭影片／軍人墓／戰爭英雄／戰爭詩人
engsen: a war film/grave/hero/poet

eng: having or producing a comfortably high temperature, although not hot
chisen: 你暖不暖和，要不要我開暖氣？
engsen: Are you warm enough or do you want me to put the heating on ?

chi: 親切友好的；熱心的，熱情的
eng: friendly and loving
chisen: 他們一家人非常熱情。
engsen: They're a very warm family .

eng: to clean something using water
chisen: 洗你的頭／手
engsen: wash your hair/hands

eng: If water washes somewhere, it flows there, usually repeatedly.
chisen: 她站在岸邊，任水漫過她疲憊的雙腳。
engsen: She stood on the shore and let the water wash over her tired feet .

eng: an unnecessary or wrong use of money, substances, time, energy, abilities, etc.
chisen: 那次會議根本沒有取得甚麼成果——純粹是浪費時間。
engsen: That meeting achieved absolutely nothing - it was a complete waste of time .

eng: unwanted matter or material of any type, especially what is left after useful substances or parts have been removed
chisen: 這個城市每年會產生2000萬噸生活垃圾。
engsen: This city produces 20 million tons of household waste each year .

eng: an area of ground in or near a city that is not built on or used in any way
chisen: 他的屍體被胡亂拋在城外的一片荒地裡。
engsen: His body had been dumped in an area of waste ground just outside the city .

eng: to look at something for a period of time, especially something that is changing or moving
chisen: 我吃了飯，然後看了幾個小時電視。
engsen: I had dinner and watched TV for a couple of hours .

eng: to be careful of something
chisen: 我必須注意自己的體重，因為我現在不怎麼運動。
engsen: I have to watch my weight (= be careful not to become too heavy) now I'm not exercising so much .

eng: a clear liquid, without colour or taste, that falls from the sky as rain and is necessary for animal and plant life
chisen: 一瓶／份／杯水
engsen: a bottle/drink/glass of water

eng: a route, direction, or path
chisen: 你知道去餐館怎麼走嗎？
engsen: Do you know the way to the restaurant ?

eng: a distance or a period of time
chisen: 昨天我們走了很長的一段路。
engsen: We walked a long way yesterday .

eng: a particular choice, opinion, belief, or action, especially from among several possibilities
chisen: 我喜歡你的髮型。
engsen: I like the way you've done your hair .

chi: （思維）風格；（行事）作風；（某事發生的）方式
eng: the manner in which someone behaves or thinks, or in which something happens
chisen: 別害怕——他就那樣。
engsen: Don't worry - it's just his way .

eng: an action that can produce the result you want; a method
chisen: 解決這個問題有許多方法。
engsen: There are many ways of solving the problem .

eng: the space needed for a particular movement or action
chisen: 對不起，我擋著您了嗎？我馬上讓開。
engsen: "Sorry , am I in your way ? I'll move."

eng: If someone gets or has their way, what they want happens.
chisen: 如果一切不是都按她的意願來，她就會像個四歲小孩一樣生氣。
engsen: If she doesn't get/have her (own) way , she sulks like a four-year-old .

eng: the bad condition or state of someone or something, especially the state of a person's health
chisen: 自從那次手術以來，他一直病得很重。
engsen: He's been in a bad way (= very ill) ever since the operation .

eng: used as the subject of a verb to refer to a group including the speaker and at least one other person
chisen: 我們今天下午能都去游泳嗎？
engsen: Can we all go to the swimming pool this afternoon ?

chi: （用作動詞的主語）所有人；（尤指作為一個整體的）我們
eng: used as the subject of a verb to refer to all people, especially when considered as a group
chisen: 我們生活的這個星球應該受到珍愛，而不該被掠奪。
engsen: This planet on which we all live should be cherished and not exploited .

chi: （用作動詞的主語，用於對孩子或病人說話時）你，你們
eng: used as the subject of a verb to mean "you", especially when talking to a child or someone who is ill
chisen: 你不想上學遲到，對不對？
engsen: We don't want to be late for school , do we ?

eng: not physically strong
chisen: 如果你幾天都沒有好好吃東西的話，覺得虛弱無力是很自然的。
engsen: It's not surprising you feel weak if you haven't eaten properly for days .

chi: 不符合標準的；不夠好的；能力不夠的
eng: not good enough, especially in ability, skill, or quality
chisen: 他一向在語言方面不擅長，但理科很拿手。
engsen: He was always weak at/in languages but strong in science .

eng: to have clothing, jewellery, etc. on your body
chisen: 翠西身著一襲素淨的黑色長裙。
engsen: Tracey is wearing a simple black dress .

eng: to become weaker, damaged, or thinner because of continuous use
chisen: 我非常喜歡這件襯衫，但是它的領子已經有些磨破了。
engsen: I really like this shirt but it's starting to wear at the collar .

eng: to allow or accept something
chisen: 我想向老闆請一段時間的假，但我覺得她可能不會批准。
engsen: I'd ask my boss for some time off but I don't think she'd wear it .

eng: the conditions in the air above the earth such as wind, rain, or temperature, especially at a particular time over a particular area
chisen: 山裡的天氣瞬息萬變，所以要帶上合適的衣服。
engsen: The weather in the mountains can change very quickly , so take appropriate clothing .

eng: a marriage ceremony and any celebrations such as a meal or a party that follow it
chisen: 婚禮蛋糕／禮服／請柬／禮物／招待會
engsen: a wedding cake/dress/invitation/present/reception

eng: the day of the week after Tuesday and before Thursday
chisen: 你是說會議在星期三開嗎？
engsen: Did you say the meeting is on Wednesday ?

chi: 星期，週（尤指從星期一到星期日或從星期日到星期六
eng: a period of seven days, especially either from Monday to Sunday or from Sunday to Saturday
chisen: 我們大約一週去看一次電影。
engsen: We go to the cinema about once a week .

chi: 週末（週六和週日，有時也包括週五晚上）
eng: Saturday and Sunday, or Friday evening until Sunday night; the part of the week in which many people living in the West do not go to work
chisen: 本／下週末我們要去拜訪一些朋友。
engsen: This/Next weekend we're going to see some friends .

eng: to have a heaviness of a stated amount, or to measure the heaviness of an object
chisen: 昨天一顆重15公噸的衛星被成功送入了軌道。
engsen: Yesterday a satellite weighing 15 tons was successfully placed in orbit .

eng: (of something such as a fact or an event) to have an influence or be important
chisen: 我們選擇新工廠的廠址時，是否離高品質勞動力比較近對我們非常重要。
engsen: Easy access to a skilled workforce weighed heavily with us when we chose a site for the new factory .

eng: to carefully consider, especially by comparing facts or possibilities, in order to make a decision
chisen: 我們只有權衡了所有相關因素後，才能決定何時開始最好。
engsen: Only when we have weighed all the factors involved can we decide when would be the best time to start .

eng: the amount that something or someone weighs
chisen: 這輛貨車的安全載重量是多少？
engsen: What weight can this lorry safely carry ?

eng: respect, influence, trust, or importance
chisen: 她的經驗的確給她的觀點增加了分量。
engsen: Her experience does give her opinions quite a bit of weight .

chi: 樂於接受；歡迎；鼓勵；支持
eng: to be pleased about and encourage or support something
chisen: 這個新任命受到廣泛歡迎。
engsen: The new appointment has been widely welcomed .

eng: to meet and speak to someone in a friendly way when they arrive
chisen: 來訪人士受到系主任的熱烈歡迎。
engsen: The visitors were warmly welcomed by the head of the department .

eng: in a good way, to a high or satisfactory standard
chisen: 這部紀錄片很好地呈現了問題的兩個方面。
engsen: The documentary presented both sides of the problem very well .

eng: very much, to a great degree, or completely
chisen: 充分揉捏麵團，然後將它分成四塊。
engsen: Knead the dough well , then divide it into four pieces .

eng: with good reason
chisen: 問她可能最合適。
engsen: She might well be the best person to ask .

eng: in addition (to)
chisen: 邀請艾蜜莉——還有斯科特。
engsen: Invite Emily - and Scott as well .

eng: the direction in which the sun goes down in the evening, opposite to the east, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction
chisen: 指南針上的方向有北、南、東和西。
engsen: The points of the compass are north , south , east , and west .

eng: used to ask for information about people or things
chisen: 幾點了？
engsen: What time is it ?

eng: at what time; at the time at which
chisen: 你甚麼時候走？
engsen: When are you going ?

eng: to, at, or in what place
chisen: 他住在哪裡？
engsen: Where does he live ?

chi: （尤用於轉述問題或表達疑問）是否
eng: (used especially in reporting questions and expressing doubts) if, or not
chisen: 我不肯定你是否喜歡它。
engsen: I wasn't sure whether you'd like it .

chi: （用於答案數目固定或有限的問題中）哪個；哪些
eng: (used in questions and structures in which there is a fixed or limited set of answers or possibilities) what one or ones
chisen: 你更想去哪個聚會——安娜的還是丹的？
engsen: Which party would you prefer to go to - Anna's or Dan's  ?

chi: （用於為前面的從句補充額外資訊，書面英語中通常用於逗號之後）那個，那些，那種情況
eng: used to add extra information to a previous clause, in writing usually after a comma
chisen: 米爾頓大街上的那家酒吧，順便提一句那裡非常棒，是特雷弗的哥哥開的。
engsen: That bar on Milton Street , which by the way is very nice , is owned by Trevor's brother .

eng: during the time that, or at the same time as
chisen: 在你吹亁頭髮的時候，我讀了它。
engsen: I read it while you were drying your hair .

eng: despite the fact that; although
chisen: 雖然我承認他在很多方面不是那麼完美，但我實際上還是非常喜歡這個男人。
engsen: While I accept that he's not perfect in many respects , I do actually like the man .

eng: compared with the fact that; but
chisen: 他每年賺五萬英鎊，而我只有可憐的兩萬！
engsen: He gets £50,000 a year while I get a meagre £20,000 !

eng: of a colour like that of snow, milk, or bone
chisen: 白色的T恤衫
engsen: a white T-shirt

eng: belonging to the group of people with skin that is pale in colour, who come from or whose family originally came from Europe
chisen: 他的母親是黑人，父親是白人。
engsen: He had a black mother and a white father .

eng: used especially in questions as the subject or object of a verb, when asking which person or people, or when asking what someone's name is
chisen: 這是誰做的？
engsen: Who did this ?

chi: （用作動詞的主詞或受詞，表示所提及的人，或附加所提及的人的資訊）
eng: used as the subject or object of a verb to show which person you are referring to, or to add information about a person just mentioned. It is used for people, not things
chisen: 我認為打電話的人是你爸爸。
engsen: I think it was your dad who phoned .

eng: complete or not divided
chisen: 我花了一整天打掃衛生。
engsen: I spent the whole day cleaning .

eng: used instead of "who" as the object of a verb or preposition
chisen: 我碰見了個過去曾一起工作的人。
engsen: I met a man with whom I used to work .

eng: used especially in questions when asking about which person owns or is responsible for something
chisen: 這是誰的袋子？
engsen: Whose is this bag ?

eng: for what reason
chisen: 你為甚麼選擇在倫敦生活？
engsen: Why did you choose to live in London ?

eng: having a larger distance from one side to the other than is usual or expected, especially in comparison with the length of something; not narrow
chisen: 寬闊的河流／道路／巨大的裂口／大腳
engsen: a wide river/road/gap/foot

eng: used to describe something that includes a large amount or many different types of thing, or that covers a large range or area
chisen: 他們銷售各種各樣的護膚品。
engsen: They sell a wide range of skin-care products .

eng: the woman that you are married to
chisen: 我是第一次見到葛列格的妻子。
engsen: I met Greg's wife for the first time .

eng: used to talk about what is going to happen in the future, especially things that you are certain about or things that are planned
chisen: 下個月克萊爾就五歲了。
engsen: Clare will be five years old next month .

eng: used to talk about what someone or something is able or willing to do
chisen: 這些義大利千層麵夠六個人吃。
engsen: This lasagne will feed six people .

eng: used to ask someone to do something
chisen: 你能不能給我她的地址？
engsen: Will you give me her address ?

eng: used to refer to what is likely
chisen: 你們可能都知道了，選舉定在下星期。
engsen: As you all will know , election day is next week .

eng: used when angry to tell someone to do something
chisen: 你能不能別那麼討厭！
engsen: Will you stop being such a pain !

eng: used when referring to something that always or usually happens
chisen: 事故總是會發生的。
engsen: Accidents will happen .

eng: to achieve first position and/or get a prize in a competition, election, fight, etc.
chisen: 如果這個政府在下次選舉中獲勝，我就離開這個國家。
engsen: If this government win the next election , I'm leaving the country .

eng: a current of air moving approximately horizontally, especially one strong enough to be felt
chisen: 風不夠大，風箏飛不起來。
engsen: There isn't enough wind to fly a kite .

eng: breath or the ability to breathe
chisen: 打在腹部的一記重拳讓我喘不過氣來。
engsen: The blow to my stomach knocked the wind out of me .

eng: gas in the bowels or in a baby's stomach, especially when this makes you feel uncomfortable or makes noises
chisen: 我愛吃大蒜，但吃了肚子脹氣很厲害。
engsen: I like garlic but it gives me terrible wind .

eng: a space usually filled with glass in the wall of a building or in a vehicle, to allow light and air in and to allow people inside the building to see out
chisen: 我打開／關上窗戶可以嗎？
engsen: Is it all right if I open/close the window ?

eng: a separate area on a computer screen that shows information and can be moved around
chisen: 將視窗最小／最大化
engsen: to minimize/maximize a window

eng: a period when there is an opportunity to do something
chisen: 我本週相當忙，但可能在星期五還有點空。
engsen: I'm busy this week but there might be a window on Friday .

eng: an alcoholic drink that is usually made from grapes, but can also be made from other fruits or flowers. It is made by fermenting the fruit with water and sugar
chisen: 酒窖／酒鑒賞家／鎮酒冰壺／玻璃酒杯
engsen: a wine cellar/connoisseur/cooler/glass

eng: the season between autumn and spring, lasting from November to March north of the equator and from May to September south of the equator, when the weather is coldest
chisen: 我想你在冬天可能會吃得更多。
engsen: I think you tend to eat more in (the) winter .

chi: （與過去時連用，對已經存在的情況表示遺憾）但願，希望
eng: used with the past simple to express that you feel sorry or sad about a state or situation that exists at the moment
chisen: 我個子再高一點就好了。
engsen: I wish (that) I was/were a bit taller .

eng: to want to do something
chisen: 只要是您想要這樣，先生。我們一定會去做。
engsen: As you wish , Sir . It will be done .

eng: to hope or express hope for another person's success or happiness or pleasure on a particular occasion
chisen: 我們祝願你將來事事成功。
engsen: We wish you every success in the future .

chi: 希望（因為好運或魔力而）夢想成真
eng: to hope that something you want will be made real because of good luck or magical powers
chisen: 我記得吹滅生日蛋糕上的蠟燭，並默默希望約翰‧李能成為我的男朋友。
engsen: I remember blowing out the candles on my birthday cake and wishing that John Lee would be my boyfriend .

chi: （用特定的言辭或舉動）歡迎，問候
eng: to welcome someone with particular words or a particular action
chisen: 他每天早上都問候我。
engsen: He wishes me every morning .

eng: used to say that people or things are in a place together or are doing something together
chisen: 那時我和西爾維婭在一起。
engsen: I was with Sylvia at the time .

eng: using something
chisen: 他被手槍近距離擊中。
engsen: He was shot at close range with a pistol .

eng: having or including something
chisen: 高個黑髮女子
engsen: a tall woman with dark hair

eng: relating to or in the case of a person or thing
chisen: 你過得怎麼樣？
engsen: How are things with you ?

eng: used to show what is on or in something
chisen: 她在桌子上擺了最精美的瓷器。
engsen: She laid the table with the best china .

eng: because of or caused by someone or something
chisen: 他痛得皺眉。
engsen: He winced with pain .

eng: against something
chisen: 我最終和她吵了一架。
engsen: I ended up having an argument with her .

eng: used with words showing separation
chisen: 我不願意花錢。
engsen: I'd rather not part with my cash .

eng: and, or followed by
chisen: 我想要牛排和炸薯條，甜點要蘋果派。
engsen: I'd like a steak and fries with apple pie for dessert .

eng: used in comparisons
chisen: 我和我兄弟沒甚麼相似之處。
engsen: I have nothing in common with my brother .

eng: supporting someone or something
chisen: 如果你想去爭取提升，我會一直支持你。
engsen: If you want to go for a promotion , I'll be with you all the way .

eng: in the same direction as something
chisen: 在賽跑的最後衝刺階段趕上了順風，所以我跑得很好。
engsen: The wind was with me on the home stretch and I ran well .

eng: at the same rate or time as something
chisen: 這種酒會隨著時間變得更加醇厚。
engsen: This wine will improve with age .

eng: to understand what someone is saying
chisen: 你看起來很迷惑——聽懂我說甚麼了嗎？
engsen: You look puzzled - are you with me ?

eng: despite something
chisen: 儘管有那麼多缺點，她仍然是個真正的好朋友。
engsen: With all her faults , she's still a really good friend .

eng: used to express a wish or instruction
chisen: 滾開！
engsen: Away with you ! (= Go away!)

eng: an adult female human being
chisen: 她真是個非常好的女人。
engsen: She's a really nice woman .

eng: a hard substance that forms the branches and trunks of trees and can be used as a building material, for making things, or as a fuel
chisen: 他撿了些木頭生了一堆火。
engsen: He gathered some wood to build a fire .

eng: an area of land covered with a thick growth of trees
chisen: 橡樹林
engsen: an oak wood

eng: a single unit of language that has meaning and can be spoken or written
chisen: 你的論文不應超過2000字。
engsen: Your essay should be no more than two thousand words long .

eng: a short discussion or statement
chisen: 經理想談一談。
engsen: The manager wants a word .

eng: news or a message
chisen: 自從保羅去紐約之後，你聽到過他的消息嗎？
engsen: Has there been any word from Paul since he went to New York ?

eng: a promise
chisen: 我說過要去拜訪他，我得說話算數。
engsen: I said I'd visit him and I will keep my word .

eng: an order
chisen: 我們正在等待總部的命令，之後才會發表聲明。
engsen: We're waiting for the word from head office before making a statement .

eng: an activity, such as a job, that a person uses physical or mental effort to do, usually for money
chisen: 我有一大堆工作要做。
engsen: I've got so much work to do .

eng: a place where a person goes specially to do their job
chisen: 你每天上班路遠不遠？
engsen: Do you have far to travel to work each day ?

chi: （尤指繪畫、書籍或音樂）作品，著作
eng: something created as a result of effort, especially a painting, book, or piece of music
chisen: 這家博物館有很多畢加索的作品，也有不少其他現代畫家的作品。
engsen: The museum has many works by Picasso as well as other modern painters .

eng: everything that you might want or expect to find in a particular situation
chisen: 新郎穿著晨禮服，戴著手套和高頂禮帽——全套的行頭。
engsen: The bridegroom was wearing a morning suit , gloves , top hat - the works .

eng: an industrial building, especially one where a lot of people are employed
chisen: 鋼／鐵廠
engsen: a steel/iron works

eng: the parts of a machine, especially those that move
chisen: 如果你把鐘的後蓋打開，就會看到那些活動部件。
engsen: If you take the back off this clock , you can see its/the works .

eng: someone who works in a particular job or in a particular way
chisen: 優秀的／不知疲倦的／技術熟練的工人
engsen: a good/tireless/skilled worker

eng: the earth and all the people, places, and things on it
chisen: 世界上不同地區的氣候狀況大不相同。
engsen: Different parts of the world have very different climatic conditions .

eng: a group of things such as countries or animals, or an area of human activity or understanding
chisen: 穆斯林（回教）世界
engsen: the Muslim world

chi: （尤指可能或確有生命存在的）星球，天體
eng: a planet or other part of the universe, especially one where life might or does exist
chisen: 昨晚的新聞報道中，有個男子認為外星生物曾經拜訪過我們。
engsen: There was a man on the news last night who believes we've been visited by beings from other worlds .

eng: a small animal with a long, narrow, soft body without arms, legs, or bones
chisen: 奇翼鳥以蠕蟲、其他無脊椎動物和漿果為食。
engsen: The kiwi bird eats worms , other invertebrates , and berries .

eng: to think about problems or unpleasant things that might happen in a way that makes you feel unhappy and frightened
chisen: 別發愁了——你沒法改變這種局面。
engsen: Try not to worry - there's nothing you can do to change the situation .

eng: If a dog worries another animal, it chases and frightens it and might also bite it.
chisen: 這些牧場裡只要發現有狗攻擊羊隻，狗就會被射殺。
engsen: Any dog caught worrying sheep in these fields will be shot .

eng:
comparative of 
bad : more unpleasant, difficult, or severe than before or than something else that is also bad
chisen: 他們的居住條件比我們想像的更糟糕。
engsen: The conditions they're living in are worse than we thought .

chi: 最差的；最糟的；最嚴重的
eng:
superlative of 
bad : of the lowest quality, or the most unpleasant, difficult, or severe
chisen: 那是我吃過最糟的一頓飯。
engsen: That was the worst meal I've ever eaten .

eng: to make marks that represent letters, words, or numbers on a surface, such as paper or a computer screen, using a pen, pencil, or keyboard, or to use this method to record thoughts, facts, or messages
chisen: 填表時，請用黑色墨水書寫清楚。
engsen: When you fill in the form , please write clearly/legibly in black ink .

eng: a person who writes books or articles to be published
chisen: 遊記／體育專欄／小說／犯罪小說作家
engsen: a travel/sports/fiction/crime writer

eng: on the day before today
chisen: 昨天你外出時他打電話來了。
engsen: He called yesterday while you were out .

eng: used to refer to the person or people being spoken or written to
chisen: 你看起來不錯。
engsen: You look nice .

eng: people in general
chisen: 年紀大些之後，你開始學會接受這些事情。
engsen: You learn to accept these things as you get older .

eng: having lived or existed for only a short time and not old
chisen: 他的女朋友非常年輕。
engsen: His girlfriend's very young .

eng: belonging or relating to the person or group of people being spoken or written to
chisen: 這是你的袋子嗎？
engsen: Is this your bag ?

eng: belonging or relating to people generally
chisen: 當然人人都希望給自己的孩子們最好的。
engsen: Of course you want the best for your children .

eng: the one(s) belonging to or connected with the person or group of people being spoken or written to
chisen: 這支鋼筆是你的嗎？
engsen: Is this pen yours ?

eng: used to show that something belongs to or is connected with people generally
chisen: 別人的孩子總是看起來比自己的更乖。
engsen: Other people's children always seem to be better behaved than yours .

chi: 令人厭惡的，讓人反感的
eng: disgusting or unpleasant
chisen: 令人生厭的綠色
engsen: a yucky green colour

eng: tasting extremely good
chisen: 我想我要再來些那種美味的巧克力蛋糕。
engsen: I think I'll have some more of that yummy chocolate cake .

eng: (the number) 0; nothing
engsen: Five , four , three , two , one , zero .
